    • Method Detail

      • verifyIdentity

        public abstract void verifyIdentity(Context context,
                  AuthPlugin.VerifyIdentityObserver callback,
                  boolean allowUI)
         When this method is called, the plugin can assume:
        

 - the game is authenticated
 - the UserSession state == authenticating
 - no other authentication plugin or authentication mechanism (f.e. GetSocial's authentication) is active.
 - the GetSocial SDK does not change the state of the session before this method has called onComplete or onError

 The plugin MUST NOT assume:
 - handlers listing for the state change from unidentified to verifying have completed.

 If allowUI is false:
 - the plugin MUST NOT display any UI to authenticate the user.

 If allowUI is true:
 - the plugin SHOULD display UI ( i.e. progress/activity indicator ) while authenticating the user.
 - if user interaction is required, the plugin is responsible for displaying the UI.

 verifyIdentity MUST guarantee that exactly one of the callbacks is eventually called. (i.e. either completeCallback or errorCallback)

 If onComplete is called, the plugin guarantee that it has called verifyUserIdentity of the GetSocialSDK.

      • clearIdentity

        public abstract void clearIdentity(Context context,
                 AuthPlugin.ClearIdentityObserver callback)
         When this method is called, the plugin can assume:

 - the game is authenticated
 - A human user triggered the log out.
 - the session state == cleaning
 - no other authentication plugin or authentication mechanism is active.
 - the GetSocial SDK does not change the state of the session before this method has called completeCallback

 The plugin MUST NOT assume:
 - handlers listing for the state change from no_user to onComplete have completed.
 - the plugin SHOULD display UI (i.e. progress/activity indicator ) while logging out the user if this takes longer.
 - the UI MUST NOT be interactive - since the logout process cannot be aborted.

 clearIdentity MUST guarantee that onComplete is eventually called when the operation has completed.
